comments.body:
Are you using ElvUI?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I am not using ELVui I'm using a modified version of Roth UI..

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1F-ot-JdW3c

Here you can see my TMW setup with timers, currently no timers work on any character. (This character is the only one I'm fuzzed about)


> Posted by CurseForge user Elistari

It looks like Roth UI uses a massively hacked version of OmniCC for its timers, which would explain why this is happening. I will see what I can do, but I cant make any guarantees because ultimately, it is the "fault" of Roth UI for using its own version of OmniCC that cannot be distinguished from the real version of OmniCC.

First, though, could you install the latest alpha version (check the Files tab at the top of this page) and see if it is fixed in that version (I did include some more tweaks to timer text options since version 6.0.4, which may or may not solve this problem for you)

Edited Nov 22, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Just an update: I talked to the author of Roth UI, and he/she agreed to include a change in the next version that will allow the timer text that is displayed by the version of OmniCC that is included with Roth UI to be toggled by the normal Show Timer Text option in TellMeWhen.

In the mean time, I can confirm that the issue should be resolved (although there will be no way to toggle the timer text off until the next version of Roth UI is released; this was the previous behavior too, though, so you actually shouldn't notice any difference in behavior) if you download and install the latest alpha version of TellMeWhen.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Hi, I'm using Tukui and am having this same issue. Is there something I can do to make this work with the UI? Thanks for any help you can give me!


> Posted by CurseForge user Roguefoxx

As I just said, I can confirm that the issue should be resolved if you download and install the latest alpha version of TellMeWhen.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Oh, ok. I thought you were just referring to RothUI. Thanks for the update.


> Posted by CurseForge user Roguefoxx

Going to close this ticket now, as the issue has been resolved on TellMeWhen's side of things, and will be further resolved when the next update of Roth UI is released.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
